1483907120470892547.text: This struggle that we are in right now – the fight to guarantee voting rights for all – is not the struggle of a single week; it has been the struggle of generations since our nation’s founding. It must -- and will -- continue.

1483904518899351555.text: These are just the facts. I’m so tired of some of my colleagues perpetuating a lie about voter security when laws across the country are actively being created and passed to suppress Americans’ basic rights to vote. https://t.co/3x97L3TZ7A

1483898051324530695.text: Senate Democrats have united time and again in the past year behind comprehensive legislation that would address the rising threat to democracy, yet Senate Republicans have blocked action every time. We will keep fighting to ensure every American can exercise their right to vote.

1483869364868857861.text: If we want to safeguard our democracy, we need to seize the urgency of this moment and pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act and the Freedom to Vote Act to ensure the voices of marginalized communities are heard and represented.

1483854266590715911.text: Since President Trump’s “Big Lie,” efforts to restrict access to the ballot and undermine free and fair elections have only increased. The federal government must act to protect one of our most fundamental rights: the right to vote.

1473661045923274753.text: It benefits us all, and we must continue making these investments to make our country stronger, more competitive, and transform the lives of future generations for the better.

1473661044807684096.text: Investing in ending child poverty is the morally right thing to do. Investing in our children is the right thing to do. And investing in our families is the right thing to do.

1473661043624882180.text: I know some people are talking about the price of this program, but the reality is, allowing child poverty to continue is more expensive for all of us, costing our country $1.1 trillion dollars every year.

1473661042207395841.text: Plus, we are on track to cut child poverty in half this year, thanks to the CTC alone.

1473661039984193536.text: The Child Tax Credit is the biggest tax cut for the middle class in decades, and it has done so much to keep working families afloat during the pandemic and allow them to reemerge even stronger as we recover.

1473661038843379712.text: Stacy and her husband in Kearny, have two young daughters and used the payments to send them back to preschool. The expanded CTC payments give them peace of mind as they face a surge of new COVID cases, potential childcare closures, and quarantines.

1473661037639606272.text: When her children's school and daycare closed in 2020, Kelly in Pitman balanced caring for her family and her full-time job. That was impossible, and she was forced to quit her job. The CTC helped her catch up on bills and make ends meet until they can get reliable childcare.

1473661036389621767.text: Margarita from Passaic, who struggles to keep the lights on despite working two jobs, used the Child Tax Credit payments to buy a backpack, notebooks, new uniforms and sneakers for her son as he started elementary school earlier this year.

1473661035005550599.text: The Child Tax Credit has transformed millions of lives across our country and right here in New Jersey. Over the past year, I’ve heard countless stories about how it's given families an opportunity to get back on their feet, and today I’m going to share a few of them.

1368253869931847681.text: We’ve also secured state & local funding needed to support our first responders, educators & essential workers; more support for small businesses, including dedicated funding to go towards small & minority-owned small businesses; and debt forgiveness for farmers of color.

1368253868690259968.text:
The landmark bill will also: 
✅Provide another round of direct cash payments for families that need it most
✅Extend pandemic unemployment assistance
✅Extend protections for renters & homeowners
✅Help safely re-open our schools & support teachers
 
And so much more.

1368253867650129920.text: The bill will expand the Child Tax Credit (CTC) & Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) to help struggling families. These tax credits will lift millions of children out of poverty, put more money into the pockets of American workers & help middle class families across the country.

1368253866370871304.text:

1322208284208701440.text: (3) Content Delegitimizing the Election. Content that baselessly delegitimizes the election—content designed to sow doubt and division—should not be amplified by the algorithms used on social media platforms.

1322208283332136963.text: (2) Voter Protection Preclearance. Just as live network TV institutes a short delay to prevent unacceptable content from airing, social media platforms can institute a short delay on content from specific high-reach accounts to allow for human review (h/t @accountabletech)

1322208282484887553.text: (1) Viral Circuit Breakers. Too often on social media, lies spread faster than the truth. A viral circuit breaker would slow the spread of viral content about the election until content moderators can conduct an effective review for accuracy.

1242926714361196545.text: I’ve been pushing for direct cash payments to get money to the people who need it most & to help stimulate our economy—the bill provides $1,200 per adult & $500 per child for most, and there’s no minimum earning requirement that would've excluded some of our most vulnerable.

1116065345587036162.text: We need a better understanding of what is happening with bias in algorithms and why. So Senator @RonWyden, @RepYvetteClarke, and I are introducing The Algorithmic Accountability Act today.

1116064566465712134.text: Research has shown that, due to algorithmic bias, well-meaning advertisers can unintentionally create discriminatory ads. And malicious advertisers can accurately target blacks, Latinos, women, the elderly, and LGBTQ members for exclusion from housing, employment and credit.

1116064348798107650.text: Sometimes this is due to intentional 1969-style ‘steering’ online on social media platforms like Twitter, Facebook, etc. – and the problems are bigger than simply removing discriminatory advertising categories.

1116064120032329729.text: The discrimination my family faced in 1969 is much harder to detect in 2019: houses that you never know are for sale, job opportunities that never present themselves, and financing that you never become aware of—all due to biased algorithms.

1116063950783819777.text: 50 years ago my parents encountered blatant, in-person discrimination called “real estate steering” where black couples were steered away from certain neighborhoods in New Jersey. But with the help of local advocates and federal legislation they prevailed.

1116063573837479938.text: We need to talk about the fact that bias in algorithms is real and the possibility to exploit tech for the purpose of discrimination against vulnerable Americans is increasingly dangerous. https://t.co/2L4vJlAsmV

1103698642962124800.text: My incredible Chief Counsel Tona Boyd is on her way right now to the Senate floor to officially introduce my new criminal justice reform bill: the Next Step Act! https://t.co/IFw5qWbtva

1103690548223897605.text:
I want to especially thank my House partner on the Next Step Act – @RepBonnie – for joining me in this work of introducing the most comprehensive criminal justice bill in decades. 

We hope this bill garners the same kind of bipartisan support as the First Step Act.

1103689749993279489.text: The Next Step Act would improve the reporting of police use-of-force incidents (currently DOJ is required to report use-of-force stats to Congress, but states & local law enforcement agencies don't have to pass that info on to federal authorities, creating a big gap in data)

1103689223738134529.text: The Next Step Act would ban racial and religious profiling.

1103689154884497409.text: The Next Step Act would provide better training for law enforcement officers in implicit racial bias, de-escalation, and use-of-force.

1103689007798673408.text: The Next Step Act would improve the ability of those behind bars to stay in touch w/ loved ones, by banning the practice of charging high rates for phone calls (> $400-$500 / month) & ensuring authorities consider where someone’s kids are when placing them in a federal facility.

1103688471661686784.text: The Next Step Act would ensure that anyone released from federal prison receives meaningful assistance in obtaining a photo-ID, birth certificate, social security card, or work authorization documents.

1103688340895870976.text: The Next Step Act would create a federal pathway to sealing the records of nonviolent drug offenses for adults and automatically sealing (and in some cases expunging) juvenile records.

1103688236642258945.text: The Next Step Act would reinstate the right to vote in federal elections for formerly incarcerated individuals (blacks are more than four times as likely than whites to have their voting rights revoked because of a criminal conviction).

1103688103485734914.text: The Next Step Act would remove barriers for people with criminal convictions to receive an occupational license for jobs, such as hair dressers and taxi drivers.

1103687900691079175.text: The Next Step Act would “Ban the Box” by prohibiting federal employers & contractors from asking a job applicant about criminal history until final stages of interview process, so formerly incarcerated individuals get a more objective shot at finding meaningful employment.

1103687555248242688.text: The Next Step Act would end the federal prohibition on marijuana, expunge records, and reinvest in the communities most harmed by the War on Drugs.

1103687317892620288.text: The Next Step Act would eliminate the disparity between crack and powder cocaine sentences (currently it is 18:1 but this bill would bring down to 1:1) AND make it retroactive.

1103686728345374721.text: The Next Step Act would reduce harsh mandatory minimums for nonviolent drug offenses: the 20-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 10 years, the 10-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 5 years, and the 5-year mandatory minimum would be reduced to 2 years.

1103682276385308674.text:

1067569996946132992.text:
Mr. Farr hasn’t just spent his career trying to ration justice, but to tip its scales for political gain. That is not the kind of judge that belongs on any court in America.

1067569995503284225.text: It’s clear that if confirmed, Mr. Farr will pursue an agenda aimed at turning back the clock & eroding the rights that generations of Americans have fought, sweat, bled & died for. https://t.co/xW3fguVxEu

1067569994035355648.text: Time & again, Mr. Farr has been at the center of efforts to degrade the full citizenship rights of Black North Carolinians, of Black Americans, of all Americans. And time & again in this process, Mr. Farr has offered misleading & incomplete testimony regarding his work & record.

1067569992105934848.text: In 2016, a voter ID law that Mr. Farr not only helped to write, but later defended in court, was found to have targeted Blacks “with almost surgical precision.” https://t.co/VSl8ibeFdQ

1067569990642135040.text: In 1990, Mr. Farr participated in a so-called “ballot security” meeting days before the Helms campaign infamously sent thousands of postcards targeting Black NC voters, suggesting they were ineligible to vote & threatening criminal prosecution if they did. https://t.co/AkSeLflyQg

1067569988708548610.text: In 1984, Mr. Farr managed the so-called ballot security program for the reelection campaign of Senator Jesse Helms that targeted and attempted to suppress the votes of Black North Carolinians. https://t.co/AkSeLflyQg

1067569987232165889.text: The facts are clear: Mr. Farr has repeatedly worked to advance a very specific, very extreme, anti-democratic agenda—one aimed at turning back the clock, and eroding civil rights, workers’ rights and anti-discrimination protections.

1067569985776701442.text: The outpouring of advocacy & activism in opposition to Mr. Farr’s federal judicial nomination is not about politics. It’s not about partisanship. It’s not about about right or left—it’s about right & wrong. #StopFarr https://t.co/rYJ8FNxgtO
